text: If you go from 0.a.b to 0.(a+1).* you get the breaking label. Or if you go from a.b.* to (a+1).*....

elements.text: If you go from 0.a.b to 0.(a+1).* you get the breaking label. Or if you go from a.b.* to (a+1).*....

text: Thanks. It seems to fit my case. (I went from 0.0.1 to 0.0.2 then 0.0.3, I guess it will stop once I pass in beta (0.1.*), should be soon anyway).

elements.text: Thanks. It seems to fit my case. (I went from 0.0.1 to 0.0.2 then 0.0.3, I guess it will stop once I pass in beta (0.1.*), should be soon anyway).

text: if development of the package has reached the point where you are making non-breaking releases, you should be at 0.1 or 1.0 at least

elements.text: if development of the package has reached the point where you are making non-breaking releases, you should be at 0.1 or 1.0 at least

text: if you’re making both feature-only and bugfix-only releases, then you should be at ≥ 1.0 so that you have all three version numbers to work with

elements.text: if you’re making both feature-only and bugfix-only releases, then you should be at ≥ 1.0 so that you have all three version numbers to work with

text: It was my last non-breaking release. Beta and official  ANN will be for next. Thanks for the explanations.
